root.Heading3Underlined: Russian State Assets and Reconstruction of Ukraine

MotionText.from_cdata: Bill to make provision about the seizure, freezing and transfer of Russian state assets; to require the Secretary of State to publish proposals for the use of such assets for the reconstruction and rebuilding of Ukraine, including an assessment of the needs of Ukraine; and for connected purposes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Road Traffic (Testing of Blood): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to amend section 7A of the Road Traffic Act 1988 to provide that a specimen of blood may be subjected to a laboratory test without the permission of the person from whom it was taken; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

MotionText.from_cdata: As amended in Public Bill Committee, to be considered.

p.span: For amendments, see separate paper (also available on the publications webpage for the Bill).

Proceedings on Consideration will (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion at 6.00pm. Proceedings on Third Reading will (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion at 7.00pm (Order of 5 March).
Scottish Parliament have each approved a Legislative Consent Resolution relating to this Bill. Copies of the
Resolutions are available in the Vote Office (also available on the publications webpage for the Bill).

from_cdata.p: Seventh Report of the Transport Committee of Session 2022-23, Self-driving vehicles, HC 519, and the Government response, Session 2023-24, HC 264

MotionText.from_cdata: That the draft Immigration (Leave to Enter and Remain) (Amendment) Order 2024, which was laid before this House on 11 March, be approved.

from_cdata.p: If this item is opposed after 7.00pm, the division will be deferred.

root.DebateTimingRubric: No debate or decision (Standing Order No. 153)
root.MotionText: Recommendations of the Infected Blood Inquiry: Christina Rees
root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 7.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
root.MotionText: Role of aviation in UK trade: Henry Smith
root.DebateTimingRubric: The first part of the sitting will last for two hours. The second part of the sitting will last for three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).
root.MotionText: That this House has considered the redevelopment of Chatham Docks Basin 3: Kelly Tolhurst
That this House has considered the accountability of the Financial Conduct Authority: Mr Alistair Carmichael

from_cdata.p: The sitting will be suspended from 11.30am to 2.30pm.

root.MotionText: That this House has considered youth homelessness: Paula Barker

from_cdata.p: e-petition 642986, Create a national strategy to end youth homelessness

root.MotionText: That this House has considered the taxation of furnished holiday lettings: Peter Aldous
That this House has considered World ME Day: Sir Sajid Javid
